title: Fan, 1880
description: Pleated fan. Leaf of painted parchment backed with plain parchment; sticks of carved, pierced and painted mother-of-pearl. Gift of Mrs. Herbert D. Robbins. The leaf shows a street scene in Nuremberg from the second act of Richard Wagner's opera "Die Meistersinger," first performed in 1868. The character of Hans Sachs, the cobbler at the left, is about to break into his "Cobbler's Song," while at the right, the lovers Walter and Eva plan their elopement. The German artist, Franz Widnmann (1846-1910) was a decorative painter of the period.
